intro: Sorindeia afzelii, commonly known as the African sandflea plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or inland dune environments. Due to its adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in arid regions.
